sections.text:
We will add workspace-level “Automation Controls” that govern auto-routing and auto-creation for each integration (Jira and Linear) with explicit opt-in enablement. Today, automation can cause accidental mis-assignment or unintended ticket creation; the goal is to make automation safer by default, clearer when active, and quickly stoppable. Controls will be scoped per integration so a workspace can enable automation for Jira while leaving Linear in a restricted mode (or vice versa), and changes will be audit-friendly.

The settings will include three run modes per integration: **Off** (no automated actions), **On** (execute actions), and **Safe Mode** with two sub-modes: **Manual Review** (queue proposed actions for an admin/approved reviewer to approve/reject) and **Dry-run** (compute and display the exact actions that would be taken but do not execute). In manual review, we will persist “proposed actions” (e.g., create issue, transition status, assign owner, add comment/labels) with the triggering event context and a deterministic “apply” operation to ensure the approved action matches what was reviewed. In dry-run, we’ll reuse the same action planning layer but short-circuit at execution, logging the plan and surfacing it in the UI.

Access control will be tightened: only workspace admins (or a dedicated “Automation Admin” permission if we already support granular roles) can enable/disable automation, switch modes, or approve manual-review actions. Non-admins can view the current automation status and dry-run previews but cannot toggle behavior. Every toggle, approval, and kill-switch activation will be recorded in an audit log with actor, timestamp, integration, previous/new mode, and (for approvals) a reference to the proposed action set.

In the product UI, we’ll surface a persistent, high-signal indicator when any integration has automation **On**, including a banner warning on relevant integration pages and a status pill in the workspace header (or integrations list). We’ll add a one-click **Kill Switch** (“Pause automation”) that immediately flips all integrations to **Off** (or “Safe Mode: Manual Review” if we want a softer stop), preventing further executions while preserving queued proposals. The kill switch should be fast and global, with clear confirmation and an easy resume flow that requires admin action and explicitly re-enables per integration.
